elements.name: ui5-ai-button
elements.description:
### Overview

The `ui5-ai-button` component serves as a button for AI-related scenarios. Users can trigger actions by clicking or tapping the `ui5-ai-button`
or by pressing keyboard keys like [Enter] or [Space].

### Usage

For the `ui5-ai-button` user interface, you can define one or more button states by placing `ui5-ai-button-state` components in their default slot.
Each state has a name for identification and can include text, an icon, and an end icon, as needed for its purpose.
You can define a split mode for the `ui5-ai-button`, which will results in displaying an arrow button for additional actions.

You can choose from a set of predefined designs for `ui5-ai-button` (as in `ui5-button`) to match the desired styling.

The `ui5-ai-button` can be activated by clicking or tapping it. You can change the button state in the click event handler. When the button is
in split mode, you can activate the default button action by clicking or tapping it, or by pressing keyboard keys like [Enter] or [Space].
You can activate the arrow button by clicking or tapping it, or by pressing keyboard keys like [Arrow Up], [Arrow Down], or [F4].
To display additional actions, you can attach a menu to the arrow button.

### ES6 Module Import

`import "@ui5/webcomponents-ai/dist/Button.js";`
---


### **Events:**
 - **click** - Fired when the component is activated either with a
mouse/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.
- **arrow-button-click** - Fired when the component is in split mode and after the arrow button
is activated either by clicking or tapping it or by using the [Arrow Up] / [Arrow Down],
[Alt] + [Arrow Up]/ [Arrow Down], or [F4] keyboard keys.

### **Slots:**
 - **default** - Defines the available states of the component.
**Note:** Although this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that
you only use `ui5-ai-button-state` components in order to preserve the intended design.

attributes.name: design
attributes.description: Defines the component design.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Defines whether the component is disabled.
A disabled component can't be pressed or
focused, and it is not in the tab chain.

attributes.name: state
attributes.description: Defines the current state of the component.

attributes.name: arrow-button-pressed
attributes.description:
Defines the active state of the arrow button in split mode.
Set to true when the button is in split mode and a menu with additional options
is opened by the arrow button. Set back to false when the menu is closed.

attributes.name: accessibility-attributes
attributes.description:
Defines the additional accessibility attributes that will be applied to the component.

This property allows for fine-tuned control of ARIA attributes for screen reader support.
It accepts an object with the following optional fields:

- **root**: Accessibility attributes that will be applied to the root element.
 - **hasPopup**: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element (such as a menu or dialog).
   Accepts string values: `"dialog"`, `"grid"`, `"listbox"`, `"menu"`, or `"tree"`.
 - **roleDescription**: Defines a human-readable description for the button's role.
   Accepts any string value.
 - **title**: Specifies a tooltip or description for screen readers.
   Accepts any string value.
- **ariaKeyShortcuts**: Defines keyboard shortcuts that activate or focus the button.

- **arrowButton**: Accessibility attributes that will be applied to the arrow (split) button element.
 - **hasPopup**: Indicates the type of popup triggered by the arrow button.
   Accepts string values: `"dialog"`, `"grid"`, `"listbox"`, `"menu"`, or `"tree"`.
 - **expanded**: Indicates whether the popup controlled by the arrow button is currently expanded.
   Accepts boolean values: `true` or `false`.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the available states of the component.
**Note:** Although this slot accepts HTML Elements, it is strongly recommended that
you only use `ui5-ai-button-state` components in order to preserve the intended design.

events.name: click
events.description:
Fired when the component is activated either with a
mouse/tap or by using the Enter or Space key.

events.name: arrow-button-click
events.description:
Fired when the component is in split mode and after the arrow button
is activated either by clicking or tapping it or by using the [Arrow Up] / [Arrow Down],
[Alt] + [Arrow Up]/ [Arrow Down], or [F4] keyboard keys.

This property allows for fine-tuned control of ARIA attributes for screen reader support.
It accepts an object with the following optional fields:

- **root**: Accessibility attributes that will be applied to the root element.
 - **hasPopup**: Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element (such as a menu or dialog).
   Accepts string values: `"dialog"`, `"grid"`, `"listbox"`, `"menu"`, or `"tree"`.
 - **roleDescription**: Defines a human-readable description for the button's role.
   Accepts any string value.
 - **title**: Specifies a tooltip or description for screen readers.

- **ariaKeyShortcuts**: Defines keyboard shortcuts that activate or focus the button.

- **arrowButton**: Accessibility attributes that will be applied to the arrow (split) button element.
 - **hasPopup**: Indicates the type of popup triggered by the arrow button.

 - **expanded**: Indicates whether the popup controlled by the arrow button is currently expanded.
   Accepts boolean values: `true` or `false`.

elements.name: ui5-ai-button-state
elements.description:
### Overview

`ui5-ai-button-state` is the item to use for defining states of `ui5-ai-button` components.

### Usage

`ui5-ai-button-state` is an abstract element, representing a state of `ui5-ai-button`. It is meant to be used in the `default` slot
of `ui5-ai-button` and should not be used as standalone component.

### ES6 Module Import

`import "@ui5/webcomponents/dist/AiButtonState.js";`
---

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Defines the name of the button state.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: Defines the text of the button in this state.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the component before the text.
The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

**Example:**

See all the available icons in the [Icon Explorer](https://sdk.openui5.org/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html).

attributes.name: end-icon
attributes.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the component after the text.
The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

**Example:**

See all the available icons in the [Icon Explorer](https://sdk.openui5.org/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html).

attributes.name: show-arrow-button
attributes.description: Defines if the component is in split button mode.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Defines the name of the button state.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the text of the button in this state.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Defines the icon to be displayed as graphical element within the component before the text.
The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

**Example:**

See all the available icons in the [Icon Explorer](https://sdk.openui5.org/test-resources/sap/m/demokit/iconExplorer/webapp/index.html).

The SAP-icons font provides numerous options.

elements.name: ui5-ai-input
elements.description:
### Overview

The `ui5-ai-input` component extends the standard `ui5-input` with **AI Writing Assistant** capabilities.

### Structure

The `ui5-ai-input` consists of the following main parts:

- **Input Field** – Inherits all standard Input behaviors.
- **AI Action Button** – Appears when focused or loading, providing access to AI-related actions or stopping generation.

The component automatically determines which elements to render based on its internal state:
- The AI Button is only shown when there are available `actions`.
- The version navigation appears only when `totalVersions > 1`.

### Keyboard Support

- **Shift + F4** — Opens the AI menu.
- **Ctrl + Shift + Z / Y** — Navigates backward/forward between AI-generated versions.

### ES6 Module Import

`import "@ui5/webcomponents-ai/dist/Input.js";`
---


### **Events:**
 - **button-click** - Fired when the user selects the AI button.
- **item-click** - Fired when an item from the AI actions menu is clicked.
- **stop-generation** - Fired when the user selects the "Stop" button to stop ongoing AI text generation.
- **version-change** - Fired when the user selects the version navigation buttons.

### **Slots:**
 - **actions** - Defines the items of the menu for the component.

attributes.name: current-version
attributes.description: Indicates the index of the currently displayed version.

attributes.name: total-versions
attributes.description:
Indicates the total number of result versions available.

When not set or set to 0, the versioning will be hidden.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description:
Defines whether the AI Writing Assistant is currently loading.

When `true`, indicates that an AI action is in progress.

slots.name: actions
slots.description: Defines the items of the menu for the component.

events.name: button-click
events.description: Fired when the user selects the AI button.

events.name: item-click
events.description: Fired when an item from the AI actions menu is clicked.

events.name: stop-generation
events.description: Fired when the user selects the "Stop" button to stop ongoing AI text generation.

events.name: version-change
events.description: Fired when the user selects the version navigation buttons.

properties.name: current-version
properties.description: Indicates the index of the currently displayed version.

properties.name: total-versions
properties.description:
Indicates the total number of result versions available.

When not set or set to 0, the versioning will be hidden.

properties.name: loading
properties.description:
Defines whether the AI Writing Assistant is currently loading.

When `true`, indicates that an AI action is in progress.

events.name: button-click
events.description: Fired when the user selects the AI button.

events.name: item-click
events.description: Fired when an item from the AI actions menu is clicked.

events.name: stop-generation
events.description: Fired when the user selects the "Stop" button to stop ongoing AI text generation.

events.name: version-change
events.description: Fired when the user selects the version navigation buttons.

elements.name: ui5-ai-prompt-input
elements.description:
### Overview

The `ui5-ai-prompt-input` component allows the user to write custom instructions in natural language, so that AI is guided to generate content tailored to user needs.

**Note:** The web component is in an experimental state

### ES6 Module Import

`import "@ui5/webcomponents-ai/dist/PromptInput.js"`
---


### **Events:**
 - **submit** - Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter
or AI button is clicked.
- **input** - Fired when the value of the component changes at each keystroke,
and when a suggestion item has been selected.
- **change** - Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter
or on focusout.

### **Slots:**
 - **default** - Defines the suggestion items.

**Note:** The suggestions would be displayed only if the `showSuggestions`
property is set to `true`.

**Note:** The `<ui5-suggestion-item>`, `<ui5-suggestion-item-group>` and `ui5-suggestion-item-custom` are recommended to be used as suggestion items.
- **valueStateMessage** - Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the component.
The value state message slot should contain only one root element.

**Note:** If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed.

**Note:** The `valueStateMessage` would be displayed,
when the component is in `Information`, `Critical` or `Negative` value state.

attributes.name: value
attributes.description: Defines the value of the component.

attributes.name: placeholder
attributes.description:
Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the
component has no value.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Defines the label of the input field.

attributes.name: show-clear-icon
attributes.description: Defines whether the clear icon of the input will be shown.

attributes.name: show-exceeded-text
attributes.description:
Determines whether the characters exceeding the maximum allowed character count are visible
in the component.

If set to `false`, the user is not allowed to enter more characters than what is set in the
`maxlength` property.
If set to `true` the characters exceeding the `maxlength` value are selected on
paste and the counter below the component displays their number.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description:
Defines whether the component is in disabled state.

**Note:** A disabled component is completely noninteractive.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description:
Defines whether the component is read-only.

**Note:** A read-only component is not editable,
but still provides visual feedback upon user interaction.

attributes.name: maxlength
attributes.description: Sets the maximum number of characters available in the input field.

attributes.name: value-state
attributes.description: Defines the value state of the component.

attributes.name: show-suggestions
attributes.description: Defines whether the component should show suggestions, if such are present.

slots.name: default
slots.description:
Defines the suggestion items.

**Note:** The suggestions would be displayed only if the `showSuggestions`
property is set to `true`.

**Note:** The `<ui5-suggestion-item>`, `<ui5-suggestion-item-group>` and `ui5-suggestion-item-custom` are recommended to be used as suggestion items.

slots.name: valueStateMessage
slots.description:
Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the component.
The value state message slot should contain only one root element.

**Note:** If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed.

**Note:** The `valueStateMessage` would be displayed,
when the component is in `Information`, `Critical` or `Negative` value state.

events.name: submit
events.description:
Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter
or AI button is clicked.

events.name: input
events.description:
Fired when the value of the component changes at each keystroke,
and when a suggestion item has been selected.

events.name: change
events.description:
Fired when the input operation has finished by pressing Enter
or on focusout.

elements.name: ui5-ai-textarea
elements.description:
### Overview

The `ui5-ai-textarea` component extends the standard TextArea with Writing Assistant capabilities.
It provides AI-powered text generation, editing suggestions, and version management functionality.

### Structure
The `ui5-ai-textarea` consists of the following elements:
- TextArea: The main text input area with all standard textarea functionality
- WritingAssistant: Dedicated toolbar containing:
  - Versioning: A component with left/right navigation buttons and a label for browsing AI-generated versions
  - AI Button: Opens a menu that can be extended with custom AI generation options through slotting

### ES6 Module Import

`import "@ui5/webcomponents-ai/dist/TextArea.js";`
---


### **Events:**
 - **version-change** - Fired when the user clicks on version navigation buttons.
- **stop-generation** - Fired when the user requests to stop AI text generation.

### **Slots:**
 - **menu** - Defines a slot for `ui5-menu` integration. This slot allows you to pass a `ui5-menu` instance that will be associated with the assistant.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Defines whether the `ui5-ai-textarea` is currently in a loading(processing) state.

attributes.name: prompt-description
attributes.description: Defines the prompt description of the current action.

attributes.name: current-version
attributes.description: Indicates the index of the currently displayed version.

attributes.name: total-versions
attributes.description:
Indicates the total number of result versions available.

Notes:
Versioning is hidden if the value is `0`

slots.name: menu
slots.description: Defines a slot for `ui5-menu` integration. This slot allows you to pass a `ui5-menu` instance that will be associated with the assistant.

events.name: version-change
events.description: Fired when the user clicks on version navigation buttons.

events.name: stop-generation
events.description: Fired when the user requests to stop AI text generation.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Defines whether the `ui5-ai-textarea` is currently in a loading(processing) state.

properties.name: prompt-description
properties.description: Defines the prompt description of the current action.

properties.name: current-version
properties.description: Indicates the index of the currently displayed version.

properties.name: total-versions
properties.description:
Indicates the total number of result versions available.

Notes:
Versioning is hidden if the value is `0`

events.name: version-change
events.description: Fired when the user clicks on version navigation buttons.

events.name: stop-generation
events.description: Fired when the user requests to stop AI text generation.
